column4: Ok, Any one have any ideas/opinions about streaming video to a personal pc over the net?
Has any one done this?
I've installed Ubuntu on slow systems and it never took more than 30-40 mins
mine took 60 mins :) if not longer
try p3 with 450mhz w/ 192mb of pc100
What kind of system do you have? :)
hehe
I just installed ubuntu for kicks though, I will be using arch linux in about 3 weeks paired up with a 24" lcd :P
I haven't tried Arch linux myself, I guess I'm stubborn on Debian and Ubuntu
lets just say arch's package manager leaves apt in its dust
Really? Big words. :)
I'll give it a go in a vm
But, dpkg works good enough for me.
the only reason I can use that system with a 24" lcd is because I use awesomewm, (tiled) :P
you will notice how much faster pacman is when you work with 450mhz machines nowadays :)
Ever use xmonad?
no, I was going to try it though, I just ended up picking awesome. (I'm fairly new to tiled wms)
but I will try xmonad and stumpwm later on
did you ever try awesome or stumpwm/ratpoisen? and what did you think of it
No honestly, I have only tried xmonad on a vm in Debina about a year ago. hehe
you could try it again, since I bet they added a ton of stuff since you last tried it
gl
